title: Russian man  confesse to Moscow car bomb attack , says Ukraine SBU ordered operation
message:
Kremlin state media on July 26 released a video purporting to show a Russian man confessing to a car bombing in Moscow earlier this week, which reportedly injured a Russian military officer and his wife.
Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) identified the man as Yevgeny Serebryakov, who in the video claimed he carried out the attack on the orders of the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU).
Russian state news agency TASS said his wife was also injured in the attack and five other cars were damaged.
Surveillance video of the moment when an apparent car bomb went off on a car in Moscow.
Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak told independent Russian media he believed there was "a malfunction with the gas equipment in the car."
event_breakdown: Car bomb in Russia near Ukraine

title: Ukraine General Staff confirms strike on Saky airbase in temporarily occupied Crimea
message:
The Armed Forces of Ukraine launched an attack on the Saky airbase in temporarily occupied Crimea, which the Russians used for launching airstrikes on the territory of Ukraine, on 25-26 July at night.
Source: General Staff of the Armed Forces of UkraineQuote: "At night, the units of the Rocket Troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, jointly with other units of the defence forces of Ukraine, launched an attack on the Saky airbase in temporarily occupied Crimea."
Information on the consequences of the strike is currently being clarified.
The Ukrainian General Staff adds that the airbase was covered by "advanced" Russian air defence systems, which once again failed to protect an important Russian military facility.
Background: A threat of ballistic missile attack was announced in temporarily occupied Crimea on the night of 25-26 July.

title: 2 senior Hezbollah official killed in an attack in southern Lebanon
message:
Two senior Hezbollah officials were killed in an attack on the village of Markaba in southern Lebanon on Friday morning, as reported by Saudi-owned Al-Arabiya.
The Qatari channel Alaraby claimed that the strikes targeted Hezbollah's regional headquarters.
The IDF confirmed on Friday afternoon that it had identified a number of terrorists entering a Hezbollah military structure in Markaba, and had struck the building soon after.
They also confirmed strikes were carried out against Hezbollah military structure in Ayta ash Shab.
Senior Hezbollah Radwan force commander Ali Jaafar Maatuk was killed in a strike in southern Lebanon last Thursday, the IDF announced.
event_breakdown: IDF confirmed airstrike on Hezbollah military structure in Markaba

title: Ukraine Targets Russian Military Airfield in Crimea
message:
KYIV, July 26 (Reuters) - Ukraine announced on Friday that its missile forces struck a Russian military airfield in Crimea, used for long-range assaults on Ukrainian territories.
This strike marks the latest in a series of impactful strikes against the Russian military presence on the occupied peninsula.
The airfield is crucial for Russian airspace control and launching strikes on Ukraine.
Ukraine has also claimed recent destruction of Russian air defense systems and significant damage to Moscow's last freight ferry, disrupting Russian supply routes.
In total, Ukraine claims to have damaged or destroyed 27 Russian warships in the Black Sea and near Crimea during the war.
event_breakdown: Ukraine claims to have struck a Russian military airfield in Crimea, used for long-range assaults on Ukrainian territories.

title: Russian attacks against Ukraine kill 3 , injure 20 over past day
message:
Editor's note: The article was updated with a casualty figure in Chernihiv Oblast and with a report from Ukrenergo.
Russian attacks across Ukraine killed at least three civilians and injured at least 20 over the past day, regional authorities reported on July 26.
Eight civilians were injured during Russian attacks against Kharkiv Oblast, according to Governor Oleh Syniehubov.
Russian attacks against Kherson Oblast killed one person and injured seven, Governor Oleksandr Prokudin reported.
In Chernihiv Oblast, one person was injured during a Russian attack against the town of Nizhyn, Governor Viacheslav Chaus said.

title: Wounded in a strike that killed her family , a 2 - year - old joins Gaza ranks of thousands of orphans
message:
Wounded in a strike that killed her family, a 2-year-old joins Gaza's ranks of thousands of orphansDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The 2-year-old toddler lay on a foil blanket, her face covered with salve for her burns and her little body riddled with scars from shrapnel.
She’s the lone survivor of an Israeli strike that hit their family home in central Gaza, killing her parents, her two sisters and her brother, along with a brother of her mother.
She spoke at nearby Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Deir al-Balah, where the overwhelmed staff rushed around her dealing with influxes of wounded.
The Israeli military rarely comments on individual strikes.
On the day of the strike that killed Siwar’s family, the military said it hit dozens of targets across the Gaza Strip, including military structures, observation posts and individual militants.

title: JUST IN : Bomb explosion injures girl in Yobe
message:
An explosion, suspected to be caused by a planted Improvised Explosive Device, has occurred at the popular Buni Yadi market in Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State.
Channels Television reported that a resident of Buni, Ali Hassan said that the incident happened at around 12.30pm on Friday, injuring a girl.
He further explained the only victim of the explosion, is currently receiving treatment at one of the health facilities in Buni Yadi.
He stressed the incident was a planted IED and not a suicide bombing incident.
Buni Yadi, located 54 kilometres from Damaturu, the state capital, was the most severely affected local government area in Yobe State during the two years it was under Boko Haram insurgent control.

Security Event 1: An explosion occurred at the Buni Yadi market in Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State, Nigeria.

title: Israeli troops battle Palestinian fighters in Gaza city of Khan Younis
message:
Smoke rises over Gaza, as seen from IsraelJERUSALEM (Reuters) - Israeli troops battled Palestinian fighters in Khan Younis in southern Gaza and destroyed tunnels and other infrastructure, as they sought to suppress small militant units that have continued to hit troops with mortar fire, the military said on Friday.
The Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) said troops had killed around 100 Palestinian fighters since Israeli troops began their latest operation in Khan Younis on Monday, which continued as pressure mounted for a deal to halt the fighting.
The Islamic Jihad armed wing said it fired rockets toward the southern Israeli city of Ashkelon and other Israeli towns near Gaza.
Medics said at least six Palestinians were killed in Israeli strikes in eastern Khan Younis.
Even while the fighting continued around Khan Younis and Rafah in the south, in the northern part of the enclave, Israeli tanks pushed into the Tel Al-Hawa suburb west of Gaza city, residents said.
event_breakdown: IDF battles Palestinian fighters in Khan Younis in southern Gaza, kills around 100 Palestinian fighters since Monday.

title: Senate Committee Seeks Information From Secret Service , FBI , Pennsylvania Police About Trump Shooting
message:
The Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee has requested information from eight federal, state, and local agencies regarding the shooting.
The HSGAC that day issued letters to eight federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies demanding information on their activities, communications, and records pertaining to the shooting.
“The senators are seeking information on security preparations, intelligence gathering on potential violence prior to the attack, and detailed explanations of the agencies’ security response,” Sens.
Kimberly Cheatle, the director of the Secret Service at the time of the incident, resigned on July 23 after congressional criticism of her testimony before the House Oversight and Accountability Committee, where she declined to share certain information requested by members of Congress.
The HSGAC also wrote to the FBI, which is leading the investigation into the alleged shooter, Thomas Matthew Crooks, who was shot and killed by the Secret Service after the attempted assassination.

title: Salma Rushdie attacker charged with supporting Hezbollah
message:
Hadi Matar, the man accused of stabbing novelist Salman Rushdie in western New York in 2022, is now facing a federal charge for allegedly supporting the terrorist group Hezbollah.
Matar, a Shi'ite Muslim with Lebanese roots, is also charged with attempted murder and assault for the 2022 attack on Rushdie.
Matar rushed the stage at a book festival while the Indian-born British-American writer was giving a speech, stabbing Rushdie in the face, neck, arm, and abdomen a total of 14 times.
Jury selection for the state trial is set for Oct. 15.
Rushdie’s latest book, "Knife: Meditations on an Attempted Murder," released in April, deals with the attack.
event_breakdown: 2022 Attack on Salman Rushdie, a novelist and essayist, western New York, United States

title: FSB Arrests Suspect Linked to Moscow Car Bombing on Ukrainian Orders
message:
Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) announced on Friday the arrest of Yevgeniy Serebryakov, who stands accused of orchestrating a car bombing on directives from Ukrainian authorities.
The FSB released footage showing a handcuffed Serebryakov disembarking from a plane from Turkiye, under the watch of masked officers.
Turkish officials reported that Serebryakov was detained following Moscow's request, having arrived in Bodrum hours after a car bomb detonated in Moscow.
The FSB alleges Serebryakov was acting on orders from Ukraine's spy agency and distributed a video of his supposed confessions, though the claims could not be independently verified.
Ukrainian officials have refuted any involvement in the incident.
event_breakdown:
Yevgeniy Serebryakov - Arrested by Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) on Friday for orchestrating a car bombing in Moscow on orders from Ukrainian authorities. He was apprehended in Turkiye after arriving from Ukraine.
The car was parked in downtown Moscow and detonated on Wednesday, six days after Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Ukrainian authorities have denied involvement in the bombing.

title: Hezbollah Doesnt Want a War With Israel
message:
Over the past few weeks, an all-out conflict between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah has begun to appear more likely.
A permanent cease-fire between Israel and Hamas would likely forestall a war in Lebanon: Hezbollah remains committed to halting hostilities if Israel strikes a cease-fire agreement with Hamas in Gaza.
During its conflict with Israel, Hezbollah has deployed new capabilities including drones and precision and antitank missiles to warn Israel against a costly ground invasion.
FLUID BALANCEOver the course of decades of conflict, Hezbollah and Israel have built a complex set of rules of engagement that have for the most part prevented full-scale war.
Membership in the axis of resistance obliged Hezbollah to join the war between Hamas and Israel on its second day.
event_breakdown: Lebanese militant group Hezbollah has warned Israel against invading Lebanon, deploying new capabilities such as drones and precision and antitank missiles.

title: Four youths charged over stabbing death of two Ukrainians in Germany
message:
Four youths charged over stabbing death of two Ukrainians in GermanyA bus stands on platform 4 at the bus station in Oberhausen.
Six months after the fatal knife attack on two Ukrainians in Oberhausen, the public prosecutor's office has brought murder charges against four young people.
Christoph Reichwein/dpaGerman state prosecutors on Friday charged four youths with murder in the stabbing deaths of two Ukrainians in Oberhausen in the west of the country in February.
The 14 to 15-year-olds have been charged with two counts of joint murder, a spokesman for Essen Regional Court told dpa.
The stabbing deaths on February 10 were met with revulsion throughout Germany.

message:

A U.S. defense official told Fox News none of the rockets landed inside the base.
The attack on the airbase also comes just one day after fighter jets intercepted two Russian Tu-95 "Bear" bombers and two Chinese H-6 bombers off the coast of Alaska.

title: Rockets launched at Iraq base hosting US troops : sources
message:
Several rockets were launched Thursday against a base hosting troops from the US-led coalition in Iraq, security officials said.
"Four rockets fell in the vicinity" of Ain al-Assad base in Anbar province, an Iraqi security source said.
Another security official said an attack occurred with "a drone and three rockets" that fell close to the base perimeter.
A US official said initial reports indicated that projectiles landed outside the base without causing injuries or damage to the base.
The US military has some 2,500 troops deployed in Iraq and 900 in Syria with the international coalition.

title: Ukraine Downs 20 Shahed Drones Overnight Friday
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Ukraine's air defense forces intercepted 20 Russian kamikaze drones in the early hours of Friday, July 26.
In total, the enemy launched an Iskander-M ballistic missile and 22 one-way attack drones of the Shahed type.
The missile was launched from Russia's Rostov region, targeting Ukraine's Donetsk region, while kamikaze drones were launched from Cape Chauda (occupied Crimea) and Kursk (Russia).
The air raid was repelled by mobile fire groups of Ukraine's Defense Forces and air defense units of the country's Air Force.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, an air raid alert went off across Kyiv region overnight Friday after a group of enemy drones was spotted in the airspace.

message:

The Ain al-Asad base came under attack by two armed drones last week, but that attack was the first one against US forces in Iraq since early February, when Iranian-backed groups in Iraq announced they would stop their attacks against US troops.
That announcement came two days after a drone attack in Jordan killed three US service members and wounded dozens of others.
Before stopping their attacks in February, the pro-Iranian militias in Iraq had upped the volume of their attacks, and launched dozens of attacks on bases in Iraq and Syria which host US troops.

title: Four teenagers sentenced for killing 16 - year - old schoolboy out of revenge
message:
Four teenagers have been sentenced for killing a 16-year-old boy out of revenge in a fatal attack where a single stab “pierced his heart”.
Kennie Carter died after being stabbed in the chest once in Thirlmere Avenue, Stretford, Greater Manchester, on the evening of January 22 2022.
On January 22 the four convicted teenagers stole bikes from a block of flats, and were heard shouting “this is revenge”.
Addressing the defendants, the judge said: “The stabbing occurred because of a perceived grievance between Kennie Carter and his associates and with the four of you.
“I am sure that the knife used to stab Kennie Carter was your knife which you took with you to use in revenge.”

title: N . J . man accused of stabbing Salman Rushdie facing additional terrorism charges
message:
The New Jersey man accused of attacking Salman Rushdie with a knife in 2022 has now been charged with terrorism after federal authorities alleged that he tried to assassinate the author on behalf of a Muslim terrorist group.
Hadi Matar, 26, of Fairview, appeared in federal court on Wednesday on three separate terrorism charges, the U.S. Attorney’s Office District of New Jersey said in a news release.
Federal authorities allege that Matar attempted to carry out an assassination on Rushdie because of the 2006 endorsement from the Hizballah leader.
The three federal charges Matar faces are committing an act of terrorism transcending national boundaries, attempting to provide material support to a foreign terrorist organization and providing material support to terrorists.
Rushdie, now 77, was blinded in one eye as a result of the stabbing, the Associated Press reported.

title: North Korea Kim calls for  people paradise  marking Korean War  Victory Day
message:
SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said it was a sacred mission of the current generation to build a "paradise for the people" based on the ideology defended by a previous generation of victors with their blood as the country marked the Korean War anniversary on Saturday.
Kim visited memorials honouring the veterans of the 1950-53 war on Friday including the Tower of Friendship remembering the Chinese People's Liberation Army soldiers who fought with the North Koreans, KCNA state news agency reported.
North Korea signed an armistice agreement with the United States and China on July 27, 1953 ending the battle in the three-year war.
North Korea calls July 27 "Victory Day" even though the armistice drew a border dividing the Korean peninsula roughly equally in area and restoring balance after the two sides had made major advances back and forth during the war.
Festivities were held throughout North Korea to celebrate the day including banquets, a parade by the revolutionary youth vanguard and a mass dance in Pyongyang's main square attended by patriots under celebratory fireworks, KCNA said.
event_breakdown: On July 27, 1953, North Korea signed an armistice agreement with the United States and China, ending the battle in the three-year war.

title: History and heritage of Maids Head Hotel in Norwich explored
message:

Anna Codutti Tulsa World Breaking News Editor Follow Anna Codutti Close Get email notifications on {{subject}} daily!

A woman was found dead outside, and witnesses reportedly told officers a stabbing suspect was still inside.

The Tulsa World is where your story lives
event_breakdown:
Tulsa police responded to a house at 1709 W. D St. at about 5:30 p.m. Sunday after receiving a call that a woman had been stabbed and found dead outside, Capt. Ryannorman, 7 p.m.
Officers surrounded the house and set up crime scene tape, Norman said.
When officers entered, they found another stabbing victim, a man. They provided aid until EMS arrived and took the man to the hospital, where he died, Norman said.
Officers found a large-scale marijuana operation inside the home, Norman said, and confiscated a "huge amount of marijuana."
Norman said there did not immediately appear to be any connection between the house and the woman who was found dead outside, and police were still investigating.
Officers with the Henryetta Police Department and the District 27 District Attorney's Office responded to the scene and are helping with the case, along with assistance from the district attorney, investigators said.

title: 30 killed in Israeli strike in Gaza
message:
Gaza, July 27 : At least 30 Palestinians were killed and more than 100 others injured by Israeli bombing on a field hospital in Deir al-Balah, central Gaza Strip, the Gaza-based health authorities said on Saturday.
The hospital was located inside the Khadija School, and the Israeli army bombed the hospital with three missiles from fighter jets, the Hamas-run media office said, noting that Israeli attacks have put enormous pressure on medical teams and caused a shortage of health and medical supplies in Gaza, Xinhua news agency reported.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a statement that based on precise intelligence, the Israeli Air Force struck "terrorists" operating in a Hamas command and control center inside the Khadija School compound in central Gaza.
"Hamas terrorists used the compound as a hiding place to direct and plan numerous attacks against IDF troops and the state of Israel," the IDF said, noting that before the strike, numerous steps were taken to mitigate the risk of harming civilians.
The IDF said in a separate statement on Saturday that IDF troops conducted targeted raids on "terror infrastructure sites" above and below the ground in Khan Younis, locating large amounts of weaponry, including shoulder-launched missiles, grenades, AK-47s, and additional military equipment.

message:

Wounded people poured into the nearby Aqsa hospital, while images from Deir al-Balah showed families carrying injured children for treatment.
Israeli airstrikes on the southern Lebanese town of Kafr Kila reportedly killed four people, as militants in Lebanon responded with a barrage of rocket fire into Israeli territory.
The strike in Deir al-Balah was accompanied by further strikes on Khan Younis, after a week of deadly fighting in Gaza’s second city.

title: Children said to be among 30 dead in Israeli strike on Gaza school
message:
At least 30 Palestinians, including children, have been killed in an Israeli airstrike on a school complex in central Gaza, according to the Hamas-run health ministry.
Israel claimed it was targeting a Hamas command and control centre based in a girls’ school in Deir al-Balah.

title: The perils of endless wars : A call for caution against a US - Iran war – Ya Libnan
message:
It is crucial to reflect on the lessons of the Iraq War to understand the potential dangers of engaging in another endless conflict.
The Iraq War, which claimed more than 4,600 American lives and countless Iraqi lives, had a staggering cost.
The financial strain of endless wars diverts resources from critical domestic programs, infrastructure, and innovation, undermining the nation’s long-term prosperity.
The lessons of the Iraq War serve as a stark reminder of the perils of endless wars.
In conclusion, the cost of endless wars is too high.
event_breakdown:
Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan
Syria: The civil war in Syria has been raging since 2011, with the Syrian government, rebel groups, and jihadist groups all vying for control of the country. The country has suffered significant damage, and hundreds of thousands have been killed or displaced.

Iraq: The Iraq War, which claimed more than 4,600 American lives and countless Iraqi lives, had a staggering cost. The war was started on the basis of false intelligence about the presence of weapons of mass destruction in Iraq. The war destabilized the country and created a power vacuum that was eventually filled by extremist groups like ISIS.

Afghanistan: The conflict in Afghanistan has been going on since 2001, when the United States invaded the country in response to the 9/11 attacks. The war has had a significant impact on Afghan society and the country's infrastructure. The United States reached an agreement with the Taliban in 2020 to withdraw all troops from the country by May 2021, but the Taliban has since retaken control of the government.

title: Chicken wire , AI and mobile phones on sticks : how the drone war in Ukraine is driving a fierce battle of innovation
message:
The Russians often fire between 80 and 100 Shahed drones against Ukraine cities each night, usually in waves.
Gun or missile air defences are then activated and moved as necessary to fire at passing Shahed drones.
The small first-person view drones carry only small warheads, which harmlessly detonate in the chicken wire, not on the tank itself.
The Shahed drones are getting quieter, receiving coatings that make them harder to detect with radar, and are being painted in hard-to-see colours.
Since Russia deployed GPS-jamming systems, Ukraine has developed digital scene-matching technology so its long-range attack drones can find their targets even without GPS.
